page.description: Functions to convert other data types to strings.

section.title: Related Functions
section.description: *HTML_ESCAPE() - Encodes ordinary text into HTML format.
A5_RFC81123DATE() - Takes a date, either as a time or character, and converts it to a string, following the RFC 1123 format.
A5_RFC822DATE() - Takes a date, either as a time or character, and converts it to a string, following the RFC 822 format.
A5_RFC850DATE() - Takes a date, either as a time or character, and converts it to a string, following the RFC 850 format.
A5_T_FROM_RFCDATE() - Converts a date string formatted by A5_ANSIDATE(), A5_RFC1123DATE(), A5_RFC822DATE(), or A5_RFC850DATE() into a time-date value.
ASC() - Returns the decimal ASCII_Value of the first letter in the specified Character_String.
CDATE() - Converts a Date to a Formatted_Date character string in the form YYYYMMDD.
CDOW() - CDOW()returns a character string containing the name of the day of the week for the specified Date.
CHR() - Returns the Single_Character corresponding to the integer ASCII_Value.
CMONTH() - Returns the Month_Name in the specified Date.
CHAR_TO_BLOB() - Returns the Blob equivalent of the original character Input_String.
CONVERT_TYPE() - Converts variables from one type to another, preserving the data if possible.
CTOD() - Converts a character string containing date information to a Date value.
CTODT() - Converts a date and time string to a time value.
CTOT() - Converts a time string to a time value.
CYEAR() - Returns a character string containing the year in the form YYYY based on the specified Date_Value.
TIME() - Returns a Formatted_String containing the system time.
TOTIME() - Returns a formatted character string containing a time based on the specified Number_Of_Seconds past midnight.
